title: Learn more about variables
text: variable computed using terra, stars /gdalwarp. following table others packages functions mentioned. Solar radiation calculated equinox day (20th March). Protected area extracted protectedplanet.net, enable extract countries.

previous_headings: Potential evapotranspiration : Penman-Monteith and Thornthwaite equation
what: The Penman-Monteith form of the combination equation is:
title: Learn more about variables
text: \[\lambda ET = \frac{\Delta (R_n - G) + \rho_a c_p \frac{(e_s - e_a)}{r_a}}{\Delta + \gamma (1 + \frac{r_s}{r_a})}  \] R_n net radiation, G soil heat flux, (e_s - e_a) represents vapour pressure deficit air, r_a mean air density constant pressure, c_p specific heat air, \(\Delta\) represents slope saturation vapour pressure temperature relationship, \(\gamma\) psychrometric constant, r_s r_a (bulk) surface aerodynamic resistances.

previous_headings: Potential evapotranspiration : Penman-Monteith and Thornthwaite equation
title: Learn more about variables
text: \(T_{mean(k)}\) mean temperature month \(k\). \(L\)average day length (hours) month \(k\). \[ = \Sigma^{12}_{= 1} (\frac{T_{mean()}}{5})^{1.514}\] \[ \alpha = (6.75e-7) ^3 - (7.71e-5) ^2 + (1.792e-2) + 0.49239 \] \[ PET_k = 1.6 \frac{L_k}{12} (\frac{10 T_{mean(k)}}{})^{\alpha} \]

previous_headings: Climatic Water Deficit (cwd) and Number of Dry Month (ndm)
title: Learn more about variables
text: CWD sum monthly difference potential evapotranspiration precipitation. CWD positive value lack water. minimal value set 0 precipitation potential evapotranspiration month. \[ cwd = \Sigma^{12}_{= 1} max(pet_i - pr_i, 0) \]

previous_headings: Climatic Water Deficit (cwd) and Number of Dry Month (ndm)
title: Learn more about variables
text: NDM annual number month cwd higher 0. include 0 12. \[ ndm = \Sigma^{12}_{= 1} \unicode{x1D7D9}_{(pet_i - pr_i > 0)}  \]

title: New Caledonia
text: Install development version cegevar Github devtools::install_github("ghislainv/gecevar")

title: New Caledonia
text: First thing import gecevar terra libraries.

title: New Caledonia
text: example, take New Caledonia example. ’s French island near New Zeland Tonga’s islands. need begin find EPSG code New Caledonia. ’s can found epsg.io. Beware keep EPSG functions package. got output vector size 5. First output character extent New Caledonia according EPSG:3163. Four next output extent latitude longitude coordinates, (extent EPSG:4326).
code: name <- "New Caledonia" epsg <- 3163 all_extent <- transform_shp_country_extent(EPSG = epsg,                                            country_name = name,                                            shapefile_path = NULL,                                            extent_short = NULL) extent <- all_extent[1] extent_latlon <- as.numeric(all_extent[2:5]) extent extent_latlon

what: Download environmental variables in one file
title: New Caledonia
text: One variable protected area named WDPA downloaded file. variable need identification country name. Make sure country name available www.protectedplanet.net. Otherwise leave country_name = NULL.
code: environ_path <- get_env_variables(extent_latlon = extent_latlon,                                   extent = extent,                                   EPSG = epsg,                                    country_name = "New Caledonia",                                   destination = "/home/pierre/Bureau/NC",                                   resolution = 1000,                                   rm_download = FALSE) r_env <- rast(environ_path) names(r_env) plot(r_env$soilgrids)

what: Download climatic variables in one file
title: New Caledonia
text: Climatic variables extract chelsa-climat.org. get get_chelsa_current function many variables. Variables give average value data recovered 1981 2010.
code: climat_path <- get_chelsa_current(extent = extent,                                       EPSG = epsg,                                       destination = "/home/pierre/Bureau/NC",                                       resolution = 1000,                                       rm_download = FALSE) r_clim <- rast(climat_path) names(r_clim) plot(r_clim$cwd_thornthwaithe)

title: New Caledonia
text: Now can merge variables one file. Output absolute path gecevar.tif file just created.
code: merge_path <- merge_files(environ_path = environ_path,                           climat_path = climat_path,                            destination = "/home/pierre/Bureau/NC")

title: New Caledonia
text: Extracted chelsa-climat.org climate data five available models, namely, GFDL-ESM4, IPSL-CM6A-LR, MPI-ESM1-2-HR, MRI-ESM2-0 UKESM1-0-LL. Compute average models SSP choosen.
code: get_chelsa_futur(extent = extent,                  EPSG = epsg,                   destination = "/home/pierre/Bureau/NC",                  resolution = 1000,                  phase = "2071-2100",                  ssp = 585,                  rm_download = FALSE)

title: Particularities
text: package, decided use Gdal GRASS feature optimization speed saving time space. way, used Cloud Optimized GeoTIFFs (COG) download subset needed climatics files. technique can used thanks gdal_translate function. R , terra stars packages help handle visualize Tiff files R object.

title: Particularities
text: Comparison 3 different areas : New Caledonia, French guyana Madagascar. area, resolution set 1km. Others parameters don’t change computing time.

title: Particularities
text: output multilayer Tiff file -32768 nodata value. values Int16 optimize space.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Pierre Guillaumont. Author, maintainer. Ghislain Vieilledent. Author. . Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Guillaumont P, Vieilledent G (2022). gecevar: GEtting Climatic Environmental VARiables open free online datasets specific region. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gecevar: GEtting Climatic and Environmental VARiables from open and free online datasets for a specific region},   author = {Pierre Guillaumont and Ghislain Vieilledent},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

what: GEtting Climatic and Environmental VARiables from open and free online datasets for a specific region
title: GEtting Climatic and Environmental VARiables from open and free online datasets for a specific region
text: gecevar provides set climatic environmental data choosen area/country can used ecological analyses. Data come variety sources Chelsa, SRTM, BRGM, various research projects environment). Climatic environmental data available multiband raster files choosen resolution (least 250m) geographic projection need.

title: GEtting Climatic and Environmental VARiables from open and free online datasets for a specific region
text: Make sure GDAL GRASS GIS installed system.

title: GEtting Climatic and Environmental VARiables from open and free online datasets for a specific region
text: can install gecevar GitHub :

title: GEtting Climatic and Environmental VARiables from open and free online datasets for a specific region
text: gecevar R package Open Source released GNU GPL version 3 license. Anybody interested can contribute package development following Community guidelines. Every contributor must agree follow project’s Code Conduct.

what: Create .tif.aux.xml legend for soilgrids layer — create_xml_legend
title: Create .tif.aux.xml legend for soilgrids layer — create_xml_legend
text: internal function.

title: Create .tif.aux.xml legend for soilgrids layer — create_xml_legend
Create .tif.aux.xml legend for soilgrids layer — create_xml_legend
text: unique_values int vector. unique values soilgrids layer. destination character. absolute path create .tif.aux.xml file. name_file character. Name file create, gecevar environ.

what: Create multilayer Tiff file with 107 variables from chelsa-climate.org — get_chelsa_current
title: Create multilayer Tiff file with 107 variables from chelsa-climate.org — get_chelsa_current
text: Gives average values data recovered 1981 2010. Monthly variables average temperatures, min temperatures, max temperatures, precipitation, potential evapotranspiration (Penman formula Thornthwaite formula), total cloud cover. Others variables climatic water deficit (Penman Thornthwaite), number dry month (Penman Thornthwaite) 19 bio variables (information chelsa documentation).

title: Create multilayer Tiff file with 107 variables from chelsa-climate.org — get_chelsa_current
code: get_chelsa_current(   extent,   EPSG,   destination,   resolution = 1000,   rm_download = FALSE )

title: Create multilayer Tiff file with 107 variables from chelsa-climate.org — get_chelsa_current
text: extent character. First output transform_shp_coutry_extend EPSG int. consider country/area. destination character. absolute path download files like () output. resolution int. meters, recommended resolution 250m, 500m, 1km, 2km 5km, default 1km. See details. rm_download boolean. TRUE remove download files folders. Keep environ.tif data_raw folder, default FALSE.

title: Create multilayer Tiff file with 107 variables from chelsa-climate.org — get_chelsa_current
text: character. absolute path climate_chelsa.tif.

title: Create multilayer Tiff file with 107 variables from chelsa-climate.org — get_chelsa_current
text: resolution need carefully choosen Tiff file big, R can crash. Unit climatic variable :

what: Create several multilayer Tiff files with 81 variables from chelsa-climate.org with futur climat variables. — get_chelsa_futur
title: Create several multilayer Tiff files with 81 variables from chelsa-climate.org with futur climat variables. — get_chelsa_futur
text: Gives predictions futur values choosen phase. Prediction multiple models (GFDL-ESM4, IPSL-CM6A-LR, MPI-ESM1-2-HR, MRI-ESM2-0, UKESM1-0-LL). Creates folder model folder mean five models. Monthly variables average temperatures, min temperatures, max temperatures, precipitation, potential evapotranspiration Thornthwaite formula. Others variables climatic water deficit Thornthwaite, number dry month Thornthwaite 19 bio variables (information chelsa documentation).

title: Create several multilayer Tiff files with 81 variables from chelsa-climate.org with futur climat variables. — get_chelsa_futur
code: get_chelsa_futur(   extent,   EPSG,   destination,   resolution = 1000,   phase = "2071-2100",   ssp = 585 )

title: Create several multilayer Tiff files with 81 variables from chelsa-climate.org with futur climat variables. — get_chelsa_futur
text: extent character. First output transform_shp_coutry_extend EPSG int. consider country/area. destination character. absolute path download files like () output. resolution int. meters, recommended resolution 250m, 500m, 1km, 2km 5km, default 1km. See details. phase character. Must c("2041-2070", "2071-2100") match years download, default "2071-2100". ssp character int. Must c(126, 370, 585). Shared Socio-economic Pathways want download.

title: Create several multilayer Tiff files with 81 variables from chelsa-climate.org with futur climat variables. — get_chelsa_futur
text: resolution need carefully choosen Tiff file big, R can crash. Unit climatic variable :

Monthly variables average temperatures, min temperatures, max temperatures, precipitation, potential evapotranspiration Thornthwaite formula. Others variables climatic water deficit Thornthwaite, number dry month Thornthwaite 19 bio variables (information chelsa documentation).

what: Create multilayer Tiff file with 11 environmental variables — get_env_variables
title: Create multilayer Tiff file with 11 environmental variables — get_env_variables
text: Variables type soil, elevation, slope, aspect, roughness, solar radiation, distance sea, protected areas, distance roads, distance cities town, distance rivers & lake.

title: Create multilayer Tiff file with 11 environmental variables — get_env_variables
code: get_env_variables(   extent_latlon,   extent,   EPSG,   country_name,   destination,   resolution = 1000,   rm_download = FALSE,   forest_year = 2010 )

title: Create multilayer Tiff file with 11 environmental variables — get_env_variables
text: extent_latlon int vector. order c(lon_min, lat_min, lon_max, lat_max). extent character. First output transform_shp_country_extent function. EPSG int. consider country/area. country_name character. country name (english) use collect protected areas. country must available https://www.protectedplanet.net/en/thematic-areas/wdpa?tab=WDPA. destination character. absolute path download files like () output. resolution int. meters, recommended resolution 250m, 500m, 1km, 2km 5km, default 1km. See details. rm_download boolean. TRUE remove download files folders. Keep environ.tif data_raw folder, default FALSE. forest_year int. Forest decade choosen. Must one 2000, 2010 2020, default 2010.

title: Create multilayer Tiff file with 11 environmental variables — get_env_variables
text: character. absolute path environ.tif file.

title: Create multilayer Tiff file with 11 environmental variables — get_env_variables
text: resolution need carefully choosen Tiff file big, R can crash. environ.tif.aux.xml extention environ.tif, allows classify soilgrid variable QGIS RasterAttributeTable extension. Nevertheless cause problems open stars package terra. problems open environ.tif, can remove environ.tif.aux.xml. solve accessibility problems stars terra packages. Unit environ variable :

what: Create a multilayer Tiff file with environ & climat variables. — merge_files
title: Create a multilayer Tiff file with environ & climat variables. — merge_files
text: Use output get_env_variables get_chelsa_current create unique file 100 variables. Can use files created get_chelsa_futur.

title: Create a multilayer Tiff file with environ & climat variables. — merge_files
Create a multilayer Tiff file with environ & climat variables. — merge_files
text: environ_path character. absolute path environ.tif file, output get_env_variables. climat_path character. absolute path current_chelsa.tif.tif file, output get_chelsa_variables destination character. absolute path download files like () output.

title: Create a multilayer Tiff file with environ & climat variables. — merge_files
text: character. absolute path gecevar.tif.

title: Create a multilayer Tiff file with environ & climat variables. — merge_files
text: gecevar.tif.aux.xml extention gecevar.tif, allows classify soilgrid variable QGIS RasterAttributeTable extension. Nevertheless cause problems open stars package terra. problems open gecevar.tif, can remove gecevar.tif.aux.xml. solve accessibility problems stars terra packages.

what: Create extent & extent in latitude and longitude — transform_shp_country_extent
title: Create extent & extent in latitude and longitude — transform_shp_country_extent
text: country name, shapefile extent EPSG value. Succed give extent EPSG reproject extent default EPSG also knows latitude longitude coordinates.

title: Create extent & extent in latitude and longitude — transform_shp_country_extent
code: transform_shp_country_extent(   EPSG,   country_name = NULL,   shapefile_path = NULL,   extent_short = NULL )

title: Create extent & extent in latitude and longitude — transform_shp_country_extent
text: EPSG int. consider country/area. country_name character. English country name, default NULL. shapefile_path character. Path .shp file, default NULL. extent_short int vector. length 4, order c(xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax), default NULL.

title: Create extent & extent in latitude and longitude — transform_shp_country_extent
text: character vector. extent area one character, latlon coord area
